newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Vietnam doubles oil products import needs for 4Q.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam doubles oil products import needs for 4Q.

text.p: Vietnam has almost doubled its oil products import requirements in its tender for October to December 1996 delivery to 609,000 tonnes, a source with state-owned Vietnam National Import-Export Corp (Petrolimex) said on Friday.
In its last tender for the third quarter, Petrolimex bought about 398,500 tonnes of oil products.
Petrolimex said the offers should be made by 1600 hours Hanoi time on September 27 and should be valid until the close of business on October 3.

The source said Petrolimex needed to buy more for the traditionally peak demand period at the end of the year and avoid a rush during the first quarter next year when the Chinese Lunar New Year starts in February.
Petrolimex also expected prices to be higher in January, he said.
Unlike previous tenders, in which it normally bought only 1.0-percent sulphur gas oil (diesel), Petrolimex is also seeking 0.5 percent sulphur gas oil in the fourth quarter tender.
It is seeking a total of 69,000 tonnes of 0.5 percent sulphur gas oil in this tender.
The details of the tender invitations were as follows (cargoes to be delivered on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis unless indicated otherwise: Product Quantity Delivery Dates Port
Gas oil (1.0-pct) 23,000 Oct 25-30 Ho Chi Minh City
Gas oil (0.5-pct) 23,000 Nov 20-25 Ho Chi Minh City
Gas oil (0.5-pct) 23,000 Dec 10-15 Ho Chi Minh City
Gas oil (1.0-pct) 23,000 Dec 25-30 Ho Chi Minh City
